meanings.definition: To regulate, control, or keep order in (an area) by means of police officers.
meanings.sent1: The officers policed the busy intersection to ensure everyone followed the traffic rules.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood was policed by the diligent officers, making it a safe place to live.
meanings.sent3: The police officer policed the playground, making sure all the children played nicely together.
meanings.sent4: The teacher policed the classroom like a strict guardian, maintaining discipline at all times.
meanings.sent5: The security guard policed the event with a watchful eye, preventing any disturbances.

meanings.definition: To make (something) neat or in order.
meanings.sent1: She policed her room by organizing her toys and books on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: The janitor policed the hallway, ensuring it was clean and free of clutter.
meanings.sent3: He policed his desk, arranging his pens and papers in a tidy manner.
meanings.sent4: The librarian policed the bookshelves, keeping them in perfect alphabetical order.
meanings.sent5: The gardener policed the flower beds, removing any weeds for a neat appearance.

meanings.sent1: The security guard policed the premises, making sure no one entered without permission.
meanings.sent2: The government policed the new regulations, ensuring compliance from all citizens.
meanings.sent3: The referee policed the game, penalizing any players who broke the rules.
meanings.sent4: The supervisor policed the workplace, ensuring all employees followed safety protocols.
meanings.sent5: The park ranger policed the park, protecting the wildlife and enforcing park rules.
